metadata.title: YouTube Monetization Requirements 2025: YPP Eligibility Guide
metadata.description: Complete guide to YouTube Partner Program requirements. Subscribers, watch hours, and eligibility.

hero.headline: YouTube Monetization Requirements
hero.subheadline: What you need to join the YouTube Partner Program and start earning.

sections.content: YouTube monetization through the Partner Program (YPP) lets you earn from ads, memberships, and more. But you need to meet specific requirements first. Here's everything you need to know about YPP eligibility in 2025.

content.title: 1,000 Subscribers
content.description: Minimum subscriber count required. Real, engaged subscribers.

content.title: 4,000 Watch Hours
content.description: Public watch time in past 12 months. OR 10M Shorts views.

content.title: Policy Compliance
content.description: Follow all YouTube guidelines. No community strikes.

sections.title: Application Process
content: Reach watch hours (4,000) or Shorts views (10M)

content.title: Two-Step Verification
content.description: Security required for your Google account.

content.title: Available Region
content.description: YPP must be available in your country.

content.title: Community Guidelines
content.description: No active strikes. Good standing required.

sections.title: Tips to Reach Requirements
content: Focus on watch time, not just views

faq.question: How long to get monetized?
faq.answer: Review takes about 1 month typically. Can be faster or slower. Having more content and engagement speeds review.

faq.question: Do Shorts count toward watch hours?
faq.answer: No, Shorts have separate path: 10 million Shorts views in 90 days. Or 4,000 regular watch hours from long-form content.

faq.question: What if I lose subscribers after applying?
faq.answer: If you drop below 1,000 before approval, application paused. Once approved, you keep monetization even if subs drop.

faq.question: Can I be rejected?
faq.answer: Yes, if content violates guidelines, reused content without value, or other policy issues. You can reapply after 30 days.
